<p> Top 10 Best Android Smartphones – Updated October 2020 </p>
<p> Finding the best Android smartphones can be tough. Even tougher to narrow that list down to the one you want, or should buy. That's where we come in. Throughout the year, a lot of Android smartphones come across our desk, making it easier to find which ones are the "best". It also makes it easier to find out which ones are not worth your attention. </p>
<p> This list has the best smartphones in different areas like battery life, camera experience, 5G, etc. So no matter what you're looking for, you'll find the right smartphone for you. If you are looking for something a bit cheaper, you can check out our Top 10 Best Value Smartphones. </p>
<p> Top 10 Best Android Smartphones 2020 </p>
<p> We're in the midst of Techtober, where many new smartphones are being released. And right now, we still have a couple more devices to be announced and made available this month – like the OnePlus 8T. But these are the best Android smartphones you can buy (or pre-order) right now. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> We've done a lot of research and have reviewed just about every smartphone that is listed here. There are a couple that we weren't able to get our hands on long enough for a review, unfortunately. So you can trust our judgement when we say this particular phone is the best you can buy. </p>
<p> Best Overall Smartphone </p>

<p> The Galaxy Note 20 Ultra is now our pick for the best overall smartphone. It sports the best in several different categories. That includes the best display, best processor, big battery, and even the S Pen is here. For $1299, it is a really good phone, and you'd expect that for that price. </p>
<p> With the Galaxy Note 20 Ultra, you're getting a 6.9-inch QHD+ AMOLED display at 120Hz. As well as the Snapdragon 865+ chipset, 12GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. There is a micro SD card slot for expanding storage as well. Samsung has also included a 4500mAh capacity battery on this one. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> The cameras have been upgraded as well, with there being a 108-megapixel main sensor, capable of 50x zoom (not the 100x zoom on the Galaxy S20 Ultra), and then 12-megapixel periscope telephoto and ultra wide cameras. It's a really great smartphone, especially for those that want the best of the best, and the S Pen. </p>
<p> Best Battery Life Smartphone </p>

<p> The OnePlus 8 Pro is our new pick for the best battery life smartphone, because well, it has incredible battery life. Which is honestly quite surprising given the fact that this has a 120Hz Quad HD+ display, and only a 4510mAh capacity battery inside. But it will get you through a full day and then some. And if you tweak the settings a bit, you can get even more juice out of this one. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> It also sports a 6.78-inch Quad HD+ OLED display, at 120Hz. There's a Snapdragon 865 chipset inside, along with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. For another $100, you can up that to 12GB of RAM and 256GB of storage too. </p>

<p> Best Camera Smartphone </p>

<p> Pixel 5 is the company's latest smartphone. It comes with a 6-inch FHD+ OLED 90Hz display, the Snapdragon 765G chipset, with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. It is available in two colors: Just Black and Sorta Sage. And it is powered by a 4080mAh capacity battery too. </p>
<p> With the Pixel 5, Google finally gave users what they wanted. An ultra-wide camera. So this one has a 16-megapixel ultra-wide and a 12-megapixel main sensor. It also has 4K60 video support, Cinematic Pans, Night Sight Portait Mode and so much more. All for just $699. </p>
<p> Best Compact Smartphone </p>
<p> Google Pixel 4a </p>

<p> That includes the same great Pixel camera. Allowing you to capture some really great looking portrait shots, as well as stunning photos at night, all on a phone that is under $400. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Internally, the Pixel 4a has a Snapdragon 730G chipset, with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. Which is right on par with some of the smartphones on this list, at a much cheaper price. </p>
<p> Best 5G Smartphone </p>
<p> Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra </p>
<p> The Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra is the only 5G phone worth buying, and that is mostly due to the battery capacity. It sports a 5,000mAh capacity battery, which will get you through the day, if not two full days. And that's needed for 5G. Seeing as the technology hasn't matured yet, it is still very battery hungry. So having a larger battery is definitely a nice thing to have. </p>

It also has support for Space Zoom, which allows you to zoom in at up to 100X. That's fairly impressive for a smartphone. </p>

<p> OnePlus 8 sports a 6.55-inch FHD+ OLED display, with a hole punch for the camera. Inside, you'll find the Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 chipset, 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. For another $100, you can up that to 12GB of RAM and 256GB of storage. </p>

<p> Best Android Smartphones – April 2019 </p>
<p> The old adage of “April showers” certainly holds true for the world of smartphones this month, as April 2019 is refreshing the top 10 list in a big way. 4 out of the 10 phones on this list are brand new to the market and represent fantastic refreshes of the previous year’s phones. There’s something for everyone here, so be sure to check out the entire list before making the decision as to what your next phone will be! </p>
<p> Samsung Galaxy Fold </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Foldable phones are the latest smartphone craze, and while they’re on the very edge of cutting-edge, Samsung isn’t wasting any time with its launch of the Galaxy Fold. Announced back in February and teased several times before that, Samsung Galaxy Fold is considered to be the first true foldable phone since it has a single large screen that can be unfolded to enhance your viewing experience. </p>
<p> Samsung’s design differs from other “foldables” that have already been launched by offering up a single, large foldable screen inside a dual-frame chassis complete with 6 cameras in total. A smaller screen is included on the outside for using the phone while it’s folded up, and the App Continuity feature ensures that moving from the smaller to the larger screen is a cohesive experience for supported apps. </p>
<p> There’s no denying that the $2,000 price tag of the Galaxy Fold is going to shut more than a few users out of this revolutionary experience and, to further complicate matters, this is a limited edition phone anyway, so Samsung is only producing a certain amount of units. The initial batch of pre-orders are sold out but it’s highly likely that Samsung will enter a second round of production to meet demand. If you want to be on the bleeding edge of tech, there’s simply no better place to find it than on the Galaxy Fold. </p>
<p> A family of phones that’s far more in reach, both in availability and in budget, is Samsung’s Galaxy S10 line. This year, Samsung has launched 3 phones to fit a wide variety of budgets and preferences. The Galaxy S10+ is the largest of the three, with the Galaxy S10 sitting in the middle, and the Galaxy S10e residing on the smallest end of the chart. </p>
<p> All of these phones deliver an identical software experience but differ in price and hardware specifications. Shared among all three sizes is the new punch-hole camera up front, which places a camera in a literal hole cut out of the brilliant OLED display. You’ll also find the incredible new Samsung OneUI, built atop Android 9 Pie, powers the experience on all phones, sporting levels of customization and features that no other OEM can top. All three phones also have a brand new ultra-wide 123-degree angle camera on back alongside the standard camera as well, giving users a wider view of the world than any other range of phones available. </p>
<p> What’s different between these three devices? The Galaxy S10 and Galaxy S10+ feature a telephoto camera in addition to that ultra-wide angle one, and both of these phones have a significantly higher resolution screen than the Galaxy S10e as well. There’s no denying that the side-mounted fingerprint scanner on the Galaxy S10e is a superior design to the in-glass ultrasonic fingerprint scanner on the other two devices though, which makes choosing between these phones more difficult than a simple price-to-size equation. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> LG G8 ThinQ </p>
<p> https://youtu.be/O3vWU4Pl7UQ </p>
<p> LG’s G-series of phones has been a bit of a rollercoaster ride over the years, but 2019’s G8 ThinQ is back on the upswing with some fantastic new features. Chief of the improvements is the Crystal Sound OLED display, which isn’t just the first OLED display on a G-series device from LG, it’s also the first time we’re seeing stereo speakers on an LG flagship phone. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Sound comes straight from the display itself, a new technology LG debuted with its OLED line of premium TVs, as well as the bottom-firing single speaker and the fantastic Boombox speaker on back. This, paired with the DTS:X virtual surround sound on the phone makes for some incredible audio fidelity without need for headphones or external speakers. </p>
<p> Folks wanting the absolute best audio experience need to look no further than the amazing quad-DAC system, available by plugging your headphones or external audio system into the 3.5mm audio jack on the bottom of the phone. LG’s range of sound and the overall fidelity of the audio that comes from this port is simply unparalleled. </p>
<p> Lastly is the new TOF camera on front. This depth-sensing 3D camera enables some interesting gestures that need a bit of work, but LG’s Hand ID technology, complete with proper secure facial recognition means that the brevity of ways to biometrically secure your phone aren’t just locked into fingerprint recognition. This new TOF camera also helps the front-facing camera take the best selfies we’ve ever seen from an LG phone, and puts the G8 at the top of the charts for best selfie cameras on the market right now. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> There’s some killer deals for the G8 through various US carriers right now too, so hit up the link below to see the best prices for the phone and where you could score a price that’s almost too good to be true. </p>
<p> Huawei has been churning out quality flagship titles every 6 months, and right on queue is the Huawe P30 family. It took some years before Huawei caught up to the best in the smartphone camera business, but 2018’s P20 Pro finally surpassed that mark, and 2019’s P30 family looks to continue that pedigree. Following up with the Fall’s fantastic Mate 20 Pro’s introduction of an ultra-wide angle camera that also doubles as a super-macro camera comes the introduction of a periscope zoom camera on the P30 Pro. </p>
<p> This new 5x optical zoom camera seems to break all conception of physics in smartphone photography as we knew it, enabling up to 10x hybrid zoom and 50x digital zoom for an unbelievable experience that you simply cannot get anywhere else. Both phones ship with a 40-megapixel rear camera but the P30 Pro, once again, has the better setup with an improved f-stop rating and the ability to raise that ISO up to an insane 409,600. </p>
<p> This bests even its own record, set on the Mate 20 Pro, and gives the P30 Pro the crown of low light champion by several leagues. There’s more to it than camera prowess, for sure, but it’s clear that Huawei has found its niche in the photography realm and is willing to go all-in to make sure it doesn’t lose that title any time soon. It’s also actually available in the US as well, which might be a shocker to many throughout the globe that have been following tech headlines. </p>
<p> Xiaomi’s Mi series started the “cheaper is better” hardware craze many years ago, and Xiaomi is still offering more bang for the buck than most other OEMs on the market. <p> Google Pixel 3a </p>

<p> We’ve shied away from including Google’s Pixel 3 family on our top 10 list since launch because, well, the phone has been plagued with bugs and problems from the start. <p> Starting at $399, the Pixel 3a, surprisingly, delivers an identical camera experience to the more expensive Pixel 3. This even includes the amazing Night Sight mode, which means the Pixel 3a is by far the best camera experience you’ll probably ever find on a phone in this price category. </p>

<p> The OnePlus 7 Pro marks the absolute most expensive phone that OnePlus has created by quite a wide margin. <p> What makes the OnePlus 7 Pro worth it when compared to every other phone on this list? Value and speed. <p> In addition to that, OnePlus is sticking with its mantra of offering more speed than the competition by providing a 90Hz OLED display on the front, capable of delivering 50% higher framerates than the vast majority of other phones on the market, including every other phone on this list (all of which have screens that run at 60Hz). <p> We’ve highlighted our ‘Good Review’ here specifically because this phone line offers so much good in so sleek a package. <p> Top 9 Best BBQ Android Apps – 2020 </p>
<p> Labor Day 2020 is coming up in the US, and many of you are probably planning to do some barbecuing for the occasion. That is even more true considering the pandemic is upon us, and many of you are probably stuck at home either way. Well, we've decided to compile a list of BBQ apps that will help you barbecue, just in case you're not an expert at it already. In the list below, you'll find nine applications. </p>
<p> Seven of those are regular apps, while the remaining two are games, actually. <p> In any case, camping is a great way to spend some time in nature, and recharge your batteries, in a way. Speaking of batteries, you'll probably be bringing your phone with you. There are all sorts of different apps included on this list, and do note that these are only our picks. </p>
<p> There are tons of other apps that we could have included on the list, but we had to choose, and this is what we've come up with. <p> Advertisement </p>
<p> So, if you don't know exactly where you're going, and don't plan to have Internet access at all, HERE WeGo is a great choice. Unlike Google Maps, it does allow you to use walking direction while offline. That is another major difference between these two apps. So, you can simply download maps for your entire state, and don't worry about it any longer. </p>
<p> This app can easily help you navigate the woods, or wherever else you're planning to go camp. The app's UI looks great, and there are quite a few interesting features included here. In fact, they function much more closely to flagships than just about any device at their price point. And there are plenty of advanced features and options underneath to ensure a personalized experience. </p>
<p> That personalized experience carries over to the OS side for both handsets too. With Android 10 and at least one update guaranteed atop frequent security updates promised, this device is nearly stock where it matters. If users want a gesture-driven experience, they can have it. If they like more traditional navigation or a combined experience, that's possible too. Meanwhile, the app drawer functions as a straightforward aftermarket launcher. And there's no lag to speak of on either device. </p>
<p> The primary differences are going to be in terms of camera features, display size and technology, and internal components. But, even there, the devices are incredibly similar and more than capable. At the more budget-friendly end, starting at just under $250 is the 6.53-inch 24-bit color panel-equipped TCL 10L. That packs a 1080 x 2340 resolution, powered by a somewhat older Snapdragon 665. TCL backed that with 6GB of RAM, coupled with either 64GB or 128GB storage. </p>
<p> The TCL 10 Pro, conversely, features a Snapdragon 675 octa-core chipset and with 6GB of RAM, coupled with 128GB storage. A 4,500mAh battery capable of upwards of 8-hours of screen-on time drives that package, compared to the 10L's 4,000mAh. The latter handset can last over 7-hours in terms of screen-on time with no issues. </p>
<p> Build-quality, meanwhile, approaches flagships in terms of design and in-hand feel. Summarily, neither phone feels cheap or performs like it is. These two phones prove that TCL is going to be a company to watch when it comes to cheaper Android smartphones. And either is well-worth a deeper dive for those who are looking for a device that performs well without breaking the bank. </p>
<p> Best cheap smartphone for 5G via Android </p>
<p> Samsung Galaxy A71 5G </p>
<p> Price: From $599 </p>
<p> Where to buy: Samsung </p>
<p> Samsung's Galaxy A71 5G, while undeniably one of the best Android smartphones around, could hardly be described as cheap. But it's a great value so we're not just talking about its nearly $600 price tag. </p>
<p> Samsung engineered its Galaxy A71 5G around a more-than-capable Snapdragon 765G and support for 5G. And that means this phone very nearly reaches flagship levels of performance. But also tosses 5G support into the mix. Conversely, that allows for more stable connectivity and a relatively small speed increase. As opposed to massive speed gains most users would see with mmWave connections. </p>
<p> That is unless consumers by the Verizon variant for mmWave support. But that handset costs an extra $50 at $649.99. So it borders on leaving the affordable category. </p>
<p> In any case, what Samsung is giving users here is a top-of-the-line mid-ranger that should match the latest flagships in terms of core features. The company built the phone on a 6.7-inch Super AMOLED Infinity-O platform. Inside that smaller-than-average front camera housing, there resides a 32-megapixel selfie snapper. </p>
<p> The main cameras are no slouch either. Of course, this is a quad-camera array with a 64-megapixel primary sensor, a 5-megapixel depth sensor, 12-megapixel ultra-wide lens, and a 5-megapixel dedicated macro shooter. </p>
<p> With all of that stacked atop a capable 4,500mAh battery with fast charging, a microSD card slot for expanded storage, and a great fingerprint-resistant design, this is undoubtedly a top choice for gaining access to next-gen networking. </p>
<p> Best cheap smartphone with stock Android </p>
<p> Nokia 7.2 </p>
<p> Price: $349.99 </p>
<p> Where to buy: Amazon </p>
<p> Nokia's follow-up to the brilliant 7.1, the Nokia 7.2 is priced at just a penny short of $350. But that doesn't mean it's a slouch in any regard. In fact, it's easily one of the best high-value smartphones on the market today. </p>
<p> The Nokia 7.2 starts out with an HD+ PureView display that's been vamped up with an HDR 10-compatible tech. The company bolstered its size from the last model, resulting in a 6.3-inch screen with a dewdrop cutout. That houses a camera for selfies at a whopping 20-megapixels. Around the back of the phone, there's a 48-megapixel tri-camera. That's a quad-pixel camera for better light and detail capture. </p>
<p> The primary camera is accompanied by an 8-megapixel wide-angle and 5-megapixel depth sensor lenses. That's a Zeiss-built snapper too. </p>
<p> The glass on the back and front is accented by a Charcoal Grey, Ice Silver, or Cyan Green coloration. Or at least it is on the rear-panel. </p>
<p> Under the hood, Nokia is providing Android 10 powered by a Snapdragon 660 SoC. That's backed by 4GB or 6GB RAM options and 128GB on the storage side — expandable to 512GB. A 3,500 mAh battery powers the package for multi-day performance under the right conditions. </p>
<p> Now, what makes this device truly special is that it's still a part of the Android One program. That means that Android 10 will be updated fairly frequently, falling in line with stock Android. It also means that Android 10 will be followed up by its predecessor at a more rapid clip than many other phones. But the biggest advantage is the ease of use and its clean, bloat-free install. </p>
<p> Best cheap smartphone that's an Android flagship </p>
<p> LG Velvet </p>
<p> Price: $599.99 </p>
<p> Where to buy: LG </p>
<p> Any conversation to be had about the best 'cheap' Android smartphones will need to include the LG Velvet. Originally sold under the company's "G" branding as a flagship, that's effectively what this phone is. But with a price as low as $599.99, it's not priced like one. And with 5G included out-of-the-box at AT&T — and arriving at T-Mobile and Verizon before 'Summer' ends — it's definitely a heavy-hitter. </p>
<p> That's not the only place this phone competes directly with Samsung's second entry on this list either. A 6.8-inch FHD+, OLED Display panel has been used here at 395 pixels-per-inch. Embedded in that is a camera that's rated at 16-megapixels. Meanwhile, the primary rear camera is rated at 48-megapixels, accompanied by a wide-angle 8-megapixel snapper and a time-of-flight sensor at 5-megapixels. </p>
<p> On sound, LG packs in dual-speakers with LG 3D Sound Engine. Bluetooth 5.1 keeps audio clean on that side of the equation. Under the hood, a Quick Charge 4.0+ enhanced 4,300mAh battery keeps things going all day or refuels in a snap as needed. </p>
<p> LG packed all of that into a completely re-imagined design that's dust-, water-, and shock-resistant. Summarily, LG Velvet isn't just one of the most beautiful sub-$600 Android smartphones on the market — even if it isn't "cheap" compared to others on this list. It's also durable. But that isn't all. </p>
<p> The company set up the LG Velvet with an overlay for Android 10 that's been exceptionally widely-lauded too. So much so that LG is bringing it to just about every other flagship-level phone it makes. That says quite a lot about the software experience here. It's a decidedly flagship-like affair. </p>
<p> Best cheap Android smartphone overall </p>
<p> Google Pixel 4a </p>
<p> Price: $349 </p>
<p> Where to buy: Google </p>
<p> Now, Google's newly announced Pixel 4a isn't going to start shipping until August 20. And it's only available in a single color configuration. That's black to reduce fingerprints and accented with a lime-green power button. So it isn't the flashiest or most personalized device out-of-the-box. The same goes for its fingerprint scanner. Google embedded that on the polycarbonate rear panel here instead of under the display. </p>
<p> Despite that, it is the most easily-recommendable Android device among cheap smartphones. It's also among the most highly-reviewed for that reason. </p>
<p> Priced at just $349, this phone comes with a processor that should stand out easily among others on this list. That's the Qualcomm-built Snapdragon 730 octa-core SoC. It isn't quite as powerful as some others but it's more than enough for most users. The search giant backed that up with a healthy 6GB RAM and 128GB storage. </p>
<p> Additionally, the same general rule applies to the phone's size. The Google design measures just 5.81-inches, not accounting for the punch-hole housing the 8-megapixel selfie snapper, and that's an FHD+ OLED panel. By most accounts, Google made the right choice in terms of scale here. The in-hand fit is going to be just about perfect for most users. Especially since many smartphones are beginning to approach the 7-inch mark. </p>
<p> All of that, of course, leads up to this phone's biggest features. Regardless of the fact that the Pixel 4a follows in the footsteps of its predecessors with a single snapper at the back, this phone will hands-down offer the best camera experience. That's because Google pulled the 12.2 MP dual-pixel camera on the back directly from the more expensive Pixel 4 series. </p>
<p> And it packed the camera with features too. Even though the telephoto lens from its larger counterpart is gone in the Pixel 4a, it can even accomplish a similar "Super Res Zoom" effect. And that's setting aside Pixel standards such as Night Sight, Top Shot, and everything else from the Pixel 4. As is Astrophotography. </p>
<p> It makes very little sense that other cameras in phones can't quite keep up despite that those are using multiple lenses. Setting aside the decent battery life, respectable performance, design, and stock Android, the cameras alone would make this the device to buy in this price category. </p>

<p> Best Chinese Smartphones – December 2017 </p>
<p> This month’s best Chinese smartphones list is a bit different than last month’s, as the OnePlus 5T arrived in the meantime, and took made the list. <p> 5. Honor 9 </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> The Honor 9 is still one of Honor’s most powerful smartphones out there. This handset is made out of metal and glass, and it’s quite compact. The Honor 9 comes with a 5.15-inch fullHD (1920 x 1080) display, while it is available in either 4GB or 6GB RAM variants, though such availability is region-dependent. The Honor 9 is fueled by the Kirin 960 64-bit octa-core processor, and the device sports a front-facing fingerprint scanner. <p> The Xiaomi Mi 6 is, next to the Xiaomi Mi MIX 2, Xiaomi’s most powerful smartphone. The Xiaomi 6 is made out of metal and glass, while its back side is curved. <p> The OnePlus 5T is the company’s second flagship of the year, it’s fueled by the same processor as its sibling, the OnePlus 5, and it also comes with the same RAM and storage counts. The OnePlus 5T is fueled by the Snapdragon 835 64-bit octa-core SoC, and the phone packs in a 3,300mAh non-removable battery, which is being recharged using Dash Charge, one of the fastest charging solutions out there at the moment. The OnePlus 5T can be pre-ordered over at GearBest in both 6GB and 8GB RAM variants, for $559.99 and $618.99, respectively. </p>

<p> Top 10 Best Chromebooks For Back To School 2020 </p>
<p> School is nearly back in session and that means it's time to sift through the top available Chromebooks to find a great new device, whether for students or educators. </p>
<p> Under ordinary circumstances, that's going to be a fairly straightforward process. <p> Chrome OS itself doesn't necessarily make matters easier either. <p> Top 8 Best Cold, Flu & Virus Android Apps – 2020 </p>
<p> Many of you are probably struggling with a cold or flu at the moment. Well, we've decided t assemble a list of the very best apps for dealing with a cold, flu, or some sort of a virus. Apps listed down below can help you self-diagnose, get help from a doctor online, or perhaps look up some home remedies for your cold, flu, and many other ailments, as these are amongst the best Android apps for that purpose. There are all sorts of apps included. </p>
<p> That being said, the world is also battling a pandemic at the moment, the COVID-19 aka Coronavirus. Google has banned Coronavirus apps from the Play Store, in order to prevent spreading misinformation, and developers using such apps in a malicious manner. There are some useful web tools that can be helpful, such as the one Microsoft launched recently. If you navigate to bing.com/covid, you'll be able to get a ton of information regarding Coronavirus, including the exact numbers of infections across the globe. </p>
<p> Coronavirus is something we all need to be vary of, and not take lightly. The pandemic will hopefully be defeated in the near future, and until then, these apps may help, though not directly with Coronavirus. These apps are mostly aimed at those of you who have a cold, flu, or something similar, as a cure for Coronavirus is not available just yet. <p> Top 8 best cold, flu & virus Android apps 2020 </p>

<p> Best cold, flu & virus Android app for analyzing symptoms </p>
<p> Ada </p>
<p> Price: Free to download </p>
<p> In-app purchases: No </p>
<p> Android version: 4.3+ </p>
<p> Ada is a great app if you're trying to analyze the symptoms you're experiencing. The developer has even added COVID-19 in its database as well, so this app can help you exclude that as an option as well. The developer would like you to think of this app as your health companion, and it kind of is. All you need to do is tell the app what's bothering you, and then answer a number of simple, personalized questions. </p>
<p> Ada will then start assessing what's wrong, and provide you with relevant information about your current health condition. You should, of course, consult your doctor if the condition ends up being serious, this app is only meant to help you get some peace of mind, and point you in the right direction. It is, by no means, a solution for your health condition. </p>
<p> It is worth noting, though, that this app is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Its registration in other markets is also pending. That only goes to show how useful the app can be, of course. The design of its UI is extremely simple, and it really does put all the focus on the content itself. The white background is combined with contrasting letters, graphs, and whatever else the app throws your way. </p>
<p> Best cold, flu & virus Android app for getting help from a real doctor </p>
<p> Doctor On Demand </p>
<p> Price: Free to download </p>
<p> In-app purchases: No </p>
<p> Android version: 5.0+ </p>
<p> If you feel the need to talk to a real doctor online, the Doctor On Demand app is the way to go. This app will connect you with "board-certified physicians and doctoral-level therapists" to talk to online, via your phone or tablet. Do note that this service is available in all 50 states (the US), and the District of Columbia. The app is not meant to be used for people who live outside of the US. </p>
<p> The service is available 24/7, so it includes both nights and weekends. You can get help whenever you want / need. This conversation will go similar to what you'd get if you go to a clinic. The doctor will take your history and symptoms, perform an exam, and then recommend the treatment. That includes both prescriptions and lab work, and they can even provide a doctor's note, if needed. </p>

<p> This works with PC and PS4 via the wireless transmitter that you plug directly into the system that you're playing games on. The Headset then connects to that transmitter. </p>
<p> It's Discord certified meaning your game chat is going to be stellar, and it can be used for other devices that accept Bluetooth audio devices. It also has audio in and out plugs, so you could even plug it into home audio systems if you wanted. It can technically be used with Xbox One, but not wirelessly. </p>
<p> For it to work on that console you would need to plug the headset into the controller's audio jack. Even then there's no guarantee that the mic would work for game chat. </p>
<p> Still, this is the best headset for lossless audio if you need something for both PS4 and PC, and this works for mobile and Nintendo Switch too. </p>
<p> Best Gaming Headset For Gamers On A Budget </p>

<p> And the Kraken X USB is essentially the pinnacle of that. It even comes in a 3.5mm version that's $49.99 instead of $59.99 if you have the hardware on your PC to support 3.5mm audio headsets. That version is also perfect for the Nintendo Switch, and mobile phones with an audio jack. </p>
<p> These feature 7.1 surround sound for more immersive gaming audio, soft leatherette ear cushions and a plushy headband cushion, a bendable mic, and in-headset audio controls. <p> While this isn't quite the same level of premium as it's LCD-GX that costs a whopping $900, it's still up there with a premium price and it reflects that price with high-quality audio. </p>

<p> Best Gaming Headset For Spatial Audio </p>
<p> JBL Quantum One </p>
<p> While there are a few wired gaming headsets on this list, none of them can do what the JBL Quantum One can do. In fact none of the other headsets can either. At least not as good. </p>
<p> The JBL Quantum One is a headset that features excellent gaming immersion thanks to spatial audio and head tracking. The head tracking works in such a way that when you turn your head to the left or right, that's the ear that you hear most of the sound from. Just as you might if you turned your left or right ear towards sound coming from the right or left. </p>
<p> It also has active noise cancellation. Once this is on you really can't hear anything but what's playing through the headphones. It's quite amazing when you're knee deep in a game. <p> Press it, and the headset will almost entirely mute the audio of the game and your chat, and let in noise from the world around you. It's rather clear too. This lets you talk to anyone in the real world who might need your attention for a few minutes, then quickly jump back into the game once you can get back to it. </p>
<p> Of course it also has things like a detachable Discord-certified microphone, RGB lighting, and the connection port is USB-C. Rounding out the big features are a super comfy adjustable headband and swivel ear cups. </p>

<p> Android Buyers Guide / Top 8 Best Google Assistant Speakers – Updated October 2020 </p>
<p> Top 8 Best Google Assistant Speakers – Updated October 2020 </p>

<p> These are the best Google Assistant speakers that are available today, in each area. There are speakers, smart displays, sound bars and much more all running the Google Assistant. The main thing to focus on when finding the best Google Assistant speakers is to pick a couple of features that are must-have features and go from there. Whether that be a display, great sound quality, or the form-factor, all of these play into what speaker would be the best for you. </p>
<p> Top 8 Best Google Assistant Speakers </p>
<p> These are the best Google Assistant speakers that you can buy, as of September 2020. From smart displays, to tiny speakers to sound bars, and everything in between. Google Assistant now runs on virtually everything. </p>

<p> Best for multi-room audio </p>

The app also allows you to send over images, video, while it does have support for GIFs (via Gboard) as well, and the same goes for stickers. </p>
<p> You can even connect your Google Voice account for phone calling and SMS texting to this application. The design of Hangouts is still quite relevant, even though Google almost completely abandoned this app, in terms of development. Hangouts is still worth using, while it's around. </p>

<p> Android Apps & Games / Top 9 Best Google Hangouts App Alternatives For Android – 2020 </p>
<p> Top 9 Best Google Hangouts App Alternatives For Android – 2020 </p>
<p> It has been quite some time since Google announced the demise of Google Hangouts. The app is still around, though, even though it probably won't linger around for long. The company already released a number of updates which removed some of the app's features, and the app hasn't really gotten a new feature in a long time. Google has a tendency of killing its services, service that it deems are not doing good enough. Google Hangouts is one of those services, and that's why we've compiled a list of Google Hangouts app alternatives for Android, for you to check out. </p>
<p> Do note that both Google Meet and Google Chat will remain available, at least for the time being. Google is basically keeping these two apps around to replace Google Hangouts, in a way. Many would argue that there are much better alternatives out there, which is why we've put together a list of them. There are tons of instant messaging services available in the Google Play Store, many of which do a better job than Google Hangouts did. We've tried to compile a rather versatile list of applications here, so no matter whether you need a more business-oriented service, or something for communicating with your friends, we got you covered. </p>
<p> Top 9 Best Google Hangouts App Alternatives For Android 2020 </p>

<p> Best Google Hangouts Android app alternative from Google </p>

<p> Google Messages </p>
<p> Price: Free to download </p>
<p> In-app purchases: No </p>
<p> Android version: Varies with device </p>
<p> The 'Messages' app, also known as Google Messages, is a solid alternative for Hangouts, but only if its RCS messaging is available in your region. The 'chat features' of the Google Messages app have rolled out to a number of regions around the world. Those are also referred to RCS messaging features, and that is something you need to activate within the app's settings. </p>
<p> If you enable it, you'll be able to send messages over the Internet to users who have that option activated as well. It sounds a bit convoluted, and it currently is, so it probably isn't the best solution for everyone. The benefit here is, that you can send SMS messages to users who don't have that option activated, from the very same chat window. This is essentially Google's competition to iMessage, though it needs to mature, that's for sure. </p>
<p> Best Google Hangouts Android app alternative for minimalists </p>
<p> WhatsApp </p>
<p> Price: Free to download </p>
<p> In-app purchases: No </p>
<p> Android version: 4.1+ </p>
<p> WhatsApp is one of the world's most popular instant messaging platforms, and it's a great alternative to Google Hangouts. The downside of this app is that you can use it on only one smartphone at the moment, as it ties in with your mobile number. <p> This app, much like various other instant messaging apps in the market, allows you to send images, videos, GIFs, and so on. The app also allows you to make free calls over the Internet as well. <p> Best Google Hangouts Android app alternative for speed </p>
<p> Telegram </p>
<p> Price: Free to download </p>
<p> In-app purchases: No </p>
<p> Android version: Varies with device </p>
<p> Telegram is one of the fastest instant messaging apps in the market, if not the fastest one. This app is extremely well-optimized, and it will offer you a great experience. The app also puts a huge focus on security. Everything you send via this application is encrypted using a combination of 256-bit symmetric AES encryption, 2048-bit RSA encryption, and Diffie-Hellman secure key exchange. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> In other words, if you're worried about security, this is one of the best apps you can have installed. The app allows you to send images, videos, GIFs, and even documents, if that's something you need. Ads are not included, and the app is completely free to use. The UI design is quite simple, and yet extremely functional. The bottom line is, Telegram is a joy to use. </p>
<p> Best Google Hangouts Android app alternative for security </p>
<p> Signal </p>
<p> Price: Free to download </p>
<p> In-app purchases: No </p>
<p> Android version: 4.4+ </p>
<p> If security and privacy is your main worry when it comes to messaging apps, Signal is one of the best options out there. This application offers end-to-end encryption, and is completely independent. This is an open-source platform, it's non-profit. Its development is supported by users, while it doesn't have trackers, at all. It is powered by the open source Signal Protocol (end-to-end encryption). </p>
<p> The app's UI is extremely simplistic, and that's what many people will appreciate. <p> Top 10 Best Headphones For Working From Home – May 2020 </p>
<p> With the majority of us working from home now, we have new distractions that we need to combat with, and that means we all need some headphones. We've rounded up the very best headphones for using while you're working from home. These include truly wireless headphones, noise cancelling headphones, wireless headphones and much more. </p>
<p> These are all going to work great no matter what your job is. Whether that's being a journalist, doing a TV show, or just doing some office work. And they'll do well for blocking out the noise around you. </p>
<p> Top 10 Best Headphones For Working From Home – April 2020 </p>
<p> As mentioned, this list does have all sorts of different headphones available. And they also do hit a number of different price points. So you're going to be able to find something for your budget and needs no matter what. </p>
<p> Best headphones </p>
<p> Bose 700 </p>
<p> The Bose 700 are ironically the newest pair of headphones on this list. They also have a really sleek style, though it's not for everyone. Bose has kept the really thick leather ear cups, which makes it really comfortable to wear for long periods of time, which is definitely a good thing here. </p>
<p> What is unique about these headphones though is that there is Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant built-in. And not in the normal way of it going through your phone. It is included in the headphones which offers a much better experience. Allowing you to have your text messages read to you and so forth. </p>
<p> Battery life is pretty respectable here, we're looking at 20 hours on a single charge. There is also a quick charging feature that gets you 3.5 hours of playback after 15 minutes of charging. Which is definitely useful. </p>
<p> Best inexpensive Hi-Res noise cancelling headphones </p>
<p> Anker Soundcore Life Q20 </p>
<p> If you don't have a lot of money to spend, the Anker Soundcore Life Q20 is the best headphones for work from home. These offer all of the goodies that these others offer, but at a much cheaper price. We're talking about just $59.99 right now. </p>
<p> Anker has a switch on the side of the ear cup for turning on and off noise cancellation which is really convenient. Especially if you don't need noise cancellation on all the time. These also offer up some really impressive battery life, we are talking about 40 hours on a single charge, and that is with noise cancellation turned on. So that is fairly impressive. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> These are also Hi-Res compatible headphones, so if you are an audiophile and really care about the way the audio sounds coming out of your headphones, then these are the ones to get. </p>
<p> Best Value Wireless Headphones </p>
<p> Anker Soundbuds Slim </p>
<p> The Anker Soundbuds Slim are a pair of wireless headphones that are going to be perfect for working from home. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Since these are not big bulky headphones, you're going to be able to wear these for hours (or the whole day), without them feeling uncomfortable. You're going to get 10 hours of battery life out of these. And they also support Bluetooth 5.0, which is going to give your smartphone better battery life too. </p>
<p> Additionally, these sport magnets in the earbuds, which make it easier to keep them together and keep the cord from getting tangled up. </p>
<p> Best on-ear noise cancelling headphones </p>
<p> AKG N60NC </p>
<p> If you prefer on-ear headphones then the AKG N60NC is going to be the best bet here. These are still pretty inexpensive, and really the only pair of on-ear headphones that offer noise cancellation. These do also fold up, making them super easy to pack if you need to go anywhere, and such. </p>

<p> The Sony WF-1000XM3 are some of the best truly wireless headphones on the market today, and at $228, they aren't the most expensive either. </p>
<p> These headphones from Sony offer up Extra Bass for some really boomy bass. As well as crystal clear mids and highs. It also offers some really great noise cancellation. So you can immerse yourself in the music in your ears. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>

<p> This Is The Best Laptop For Students </p>
<p> Does your student need a new laptop for school this year? Well, we have found the very best laptop for students, and it fits all students. From elementary up to College. Though elementary students may not need a computer this powerful, unless they want to do some gaming. </p>
<p> That laptop is the Microsoft Surface Laptop 3. </p>
<p> Why is it the best laptop for students? </p>
<p> Firstly, the Surface Laptop 3 is a lightweight, and clean looking laptop. That also comes in a few different colors, so students can get one that fits their style the best. </p>
<p> It's also pretty well specced. And comes in two sizes, 13.5-inch and 15-inch. So whether your student wants something on the smaller side, or something on the larger side, there's something for both of them. </p>
<p> We also cannot forget about the Alcantara on the keyboard and trackpad. Which makes typing on this laptop an absolute joy. Especially if you're spending all day in front of the screen. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Battery life on the Surface Laptop 3 is pretty good, coming in at 11.5 hours of usage. That should be enough to get through a school day and then some. And if you need some extra juice, you can use your phone charger to charge the Surface Laptop 3. That's right, it charges via USB-C, though you will need something bigger than a 18W charger to charge this one. </p>
<p> Surface Laptop 3 also uses Windows Hello, making it super simple to login in a pinch. This uses the webcam that is built into the bezel, and that's something that students are going to need for those Zoom and BlueJeans calls that they will be on all semester long. </p>
<p> Speaking of things students will be using all semester long, you can also access Microsoft Office 365 on the Surface Laptop 3. Making it easier to deal with email, Word documents, Powerpoint presentations and much more. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> It's a really great package, even though you can probably get something higher-specced for a lower price, the features, and portability of the Surface Laptop 3 make it a much better option. </p>
<p> Is it a good laptop for gaming? </p>
<p> The Surface Laptop 3 is not a gaming laptop. But that does not mean you can't use it for gaming. </p>
<p> It runs on a tenth-generation Intel Core i5 chipset, and you can get an upgraded model with an i7 inside. So this is a very capable machine. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> The 13.5-inch model comes with Intel Iris Plus graphics. Those aren't the best, but it will get the job done. </p>
<p> If you want something with a more powerful graphics card, pick up the 15-inch model. This year, the 15-inch Surface Laptop 3 is an AMD-powered laptop. With the Ryzen 5 running things. And it comes with the AMD Radeon Vega 9 or you can upgrade to AMD Radeon RX Vega 11 Graphics. That's a big upgrade over the 13.5-inch model. So if your student is also a gamer, the 15-inch model might be the better option. And it's starting price is only $200 more. </p>
<p> How much is it, and where can I get it? </p>
<p> The Surface Laptop 3 normally starts at $1299 for the 13.5-inch model and $1499 for the 15-inch model. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> However, at the time of writing this, all of the Surface Laptop 3 configurations are at least $300 off of their regular prices. So you can get a 13.5-inch for $999, or the 15-inch for $1199. Which are really great prices, putting them on par with the MacBook Air. </p>
<p> The base model comes with 8GB of RAM and 256GB of SSD storage. There are also models with 16GB of RAM and 256GB of SSD, 16GB of RAM and 512GB of SSD and finally 16GB of RAM and 1TB of storage. </p>
<p> For the majority of people, the base model is going to be perfectly fine. But if you would like more RAM, then the 16GB/256GB is another good option. That price is $1249 currently ($1549 normally). </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Both the 13.5 and 15-inch Surface Laptop 3 comes in four colors – Platinum, Cobalt Blue, Matte Black, and Sandstone. The Sandstone and Cobalt Blue come with alcantara on the keyboard. While the Matte Black and Platinum are available in metal only. So you can pick which material you'd rather have on your laptop. </p>

<p> Top 7 Best Mesh WiFi Routers – Updated October 2020 </p>
<p> These days, we are all using our home WiFi a lot more than in the past. With most of us working from home, streaming a lot more content and even our kids are now going to school virtually. That means that we all want the very best WiFi connection, speed and coverage available. Mesh WiFi can do that for you. </p>
<p> Mesh WiFi routers are set up to blanket your home in WiFi. So you will never need to worry about coverage gaps ever again. It extends coverage much further than a traditional router would. It's kind of like having three routers in your home, except it's all the same network. Mesh WiFi routers also have a pretty simple setup these days. Making it super easy, even for the most technology illiterate person to set up. </p>
<p> Mesh WiFi vs Range Extenders </p>
<p> You might be wondering why you would want a Mesh WiFi system over a range extender? Well there are a couple of reasons why. The big one being the fact that range extenders "repeat" your signal. This results in more coverage, but slower speeds. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Mesh WiFi is better in this regard, because it doesn't repeat the signal, and in a lot of instances, you will get faster speeds than your ISP actually markets for your plan. For example, I pay for the 300Mbps plan from Comcast. But I can usually pull down around 375Mbps. </p>
<p> Best overall Mesh WiFi Router </p>
<p> Nest WiFi </p>
<p> Nest WiFi is by far the best mesh WiFi router. It offers up a very easy setup process. Basically download the Nest WiFi app, and it'll walk you through the setup process. </p>
<p> It's also great for blanketing your home in WiFi. This two-pack can cover 4,400 square-feet. Additionally, you can add more Nest WiFi routers to your setup, if you need a bit more coverage. Nest WiFi is also really good about moving devices from the 2.4GHz network to the 5GHz network when needed. It can handle up to 200 devices on the network. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Nest WiFi makes it very easy to setup a guest network and even share your WiFi password with others. </p>
<p> Best for larger homes </p>
<p> eero 6 Mesh WiFi </p>
<p> Amazon recently announced a brand new eero Mesh Wifi Router, it's the eero 6. This particular model has all of the popular features of the other eero routers, but now it has support for WiFi 6. Making it future proof, for a good amount of time. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> With eero, not only do you get better coverage and better speeds, but it's also great for controlling smart home devices. Particularly the eero 6, as it has a built-in Zigbee hub. Making it super easy to set up your smart home. </p>
<p> This single eero 6 will cover around 1,500 square-feet of your home. And provide speeds up to 900Mbps. You can also buy the extender, which is $199 total. And purchase more eero's to go around your home, if 1,500 square-feet is not quite big enough for you. </p>
<p> Best for gigabit WiFi </p>
<p> Ubiquiti UniFi Dream Machine </p>
<p> Ubiquiti is really well-known for doing WiFi networks for large office spaces. And now, the Ubiquiti UniFi Dream Machine can be in your home, running your WiFi network. It's best for those with faster internet speeds, like gigabit speeds. It has a managed 4-port Gigabit switch as well. </p>
<p> As you'd expect from Ubiquiti, it has advanced security gateway with IDS/IPS and DPI. it also has the UniFi Network controller with intuitive User Interface. </p>
<p> This is a very powerful Mesh WiFi router and will provide some really great speeds for your home. </p>
<p> Best WiFi 6 mesh router </p>
<p> NETGEAR Orbi Whole Home Tri-Band Mesh WiFi 6 System </p>
<p> If you're familiar with NETGEAR Orbi, then you'll be familiar with this Mesh WiFi Router. It offers the same great performance as other Orbi options, but with WiFi 6 support. Meaning that it is going to be future-proof for a little while. Allowing you to really get a router and not worry about upgrading it for at least five years, or even longer. </p>
<p> With the Orbi, you are able to use this two-pack to cover 5,000 square-feet and up to 60 devices. It will automatically move devices from 2.4GHz to the 5GHz network. So if you have a smart doorbell on your network, it will keep it on the 2.4GHz network as it needs coverage more than the speed. So 2.4GHz works better for it. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Much like the others on this list, the Orbi is also great at setup, and control through the Orbi app. Allowing you to kick off devices you don't want on your network and much more. </p>
<p> Best for gamers </p>
<p> AmpliFi Gamer’s Edition WiFi System </p>
<p> This is the gamer's edition of the AmpliFi, which includes a mesh WiFi router that has an easy-to-use touchscreen display. It also includes two MeshPoints to maximize coverage and eliminate dead zones in your home. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> AmpliFi has included four gigabit ethernet ports here, as well as a WAN port, and an ethernet cable. This setup can cover up to 10,000 square-feet. </p>
<p> The MeshPoints can be plugged in, anywhere in your home. As these do not need a table to sit on, they just plug into the wall. Which means you won't need to worry about them being on the ground, not getting the right signal. </p>
<p> Best mesh WiFi router with advanced cyber threat protection </p>
<p> Netgear Orbi Whole Home Mesh WiFi System </p>
<p> The Netgear Orbi Whole Home Mesh WiFi System has a few different integrations included, which makes it really great. Like the advanced cyber threat protection. So you can keep your network and the devices connected to it safe. Thanks to Netgear Armor. </p>
<p> It also has support for Disney Circle, which is going to allow you to set parental controls for your kids. </p>
<p> With the Orbi, you are able to use this three-pack to cover 7,500 square-feet and up to 60 devices. It will automatically move devices from 2.4GHz to the 5GHz network. So if you have a smart doorbell on your network, it will keep it on the 2.4GHz network as it needs coverage more than the speed. So 2.4GHz works better for it. </p>
<p> Much like the others on this list, the Orbi is also great at setup, and control through the Orbi app. Allowing you to kick off devices you don't want on your network and much more. </p>

<p> Android Buyers Guide / Top 7 Best Micro SD Cards For Android – Updated October 2020 </p>
<p> Top 7 Best Micro SD Cards For Android – Updated October 2020 </p>
<p> When you are looking for a new micro SD card for your smartphone, there are a ton of options. And there's also a lot of numbers and letters in their name that indicate different things. But for most people, they may not know that these are important. For instance, a 60Mb/s card versus a 90Mb/s card, why does someone need a faster read/write speed? Well mainly for recording video. But that's just one of the things to look for when getting a new micro SD card. </p>
<p> Micro SD cards can be used in your smartphone (that's where they most commonly are used). But they can also be used in GoPro's, Nintendo Switch's and much more. </p>
<p> Top 7 Best Micro SD Cards </p>
<p> In this list, we have rounded up the best micro SD cards available for different use-cases. Like the most affordable, the absolute best micro SD card, the one that's going to last you the longest, etc. These do range in price from a few bucks to a few hundred bucks. So it's worth checking out. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> These will all work with smartphones, a Go Pro or a Nintendo Switch, and they also all come with a SD card adapter so they can be used in a laptop or even a DSLR camera too. </p>
<p> Best overall micro SD card </p>
<p> Samsung EVO Plus 128GB </p>
<p> The Samsung EVO Plus 128GB micro SD Card is the best overall micro SD card for a few reasons. Firstly, it's pretty cheap. Secondly, it has great read and write speeds and thirdly, it has a pretty decent capacity. </p>
<p> This card has read and write speeds of 100MB/s and 90MB/s respectively. That's pretty fast, and that's going to make it easier use it in your smartphone to save video and pictures, and even have apps running on it. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> At 128GB of storage, that's a ton of space for photos and videos to store on your smartphone. Especially good if you are one that uses your phone to make vlogs and stuff. It is also available in a few other capacities too, including 64GB and 256GB in case you want to spend less, or you need a bit more storage on your smartphone. </p>
<p> Best capacity micro SD Card </p>
<p> SanDisk Extreme 1TB </p>
<p> Who would have thought a few years ago that we could fit 1TB of storage on something as small as a micro SD card? Well it's possible and it isn't priced insanely either. It's currently priced at $259, which is about the same price you'd pay for a portable SSD of the same capacity (if not less). </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> At 1TB, you're going to have a ton of storage for everything. Whether that's just photos and videos, or some apps, music or something else for your smartphone. This is actually a really great option for content creators and those that shoot a lot of content on their smartphone. As you're going to get plenty of room for all of that 4K footage. </p>
<p> This particular micro SD card can read at up to 160MB/s and write at about 90MB/s. This means that you aren't going to have any issues with your phone taking extra time to write the footage you just shot, to your micro SD card. And best of all, it's rated at A2, which means that it is going to be about the same speed as the storage in your smartphone, and making it easier to run apps from it. </p>
<p> Best Affordable micro SD Card </p>
<p> PNY Elite-X 64GB </p>
<p> This is the best affordable micro SD card because it doesn't skimp on quality to make it a pretty inexpensive micro SD card. And you still get a pretty good amount of storage here. The PNY Elite-X 64GB is available for around $13 (sometimes less), making it the cheapest option on this list. </p>
<p> With 64GB of storage, there is plenty of space for storing your photos and videos. As well as running apps off of your micro SD card. This is rated at A1, so it is going to be really good for running apps on your smartphone. So if you have a device that supports Adoptable Storage, the PNY Elite-X 64GB is a really good option. </p>
<p> PNY also has some pretty good read and write speeds on the Elite-X 64GB. We're looking at 100MB/s on both the read and write. That's fast enough to move files around pretty much instantly, as well as shooting 4K video with ease. </p>
<p> Best for Apps & Games storage </p>
<p> SanDisk Ultra 256GB </p>
<p> The SanDisk Ultra 256GB is actually a really good micro SD card for just about everything. But it is particularly good for storing apps and games on your phone. That is because it does have the A1 rating. This means that the storage is optimized for storing apps and games inside your smartphone. Allowing you to add more storage to your smartphone with ease. </p>
<p> On top of that, you are also getting 256GB of storage here. That's plenty of space for storing some games, as well as some photos and videos. So it's also really good for content creators because it is a high capacity card. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Much like a number of other options on this best micro SD cards list, the SanDisk Ultra 256GB also has support for 100MB/s on both read and write. That's fast enough for doing just about anything. </p>
<p> Best for recording 4K video </p>
<p> Samsung EVO Select 128GB </p>
<p> We are listing this Samsung EVO Select micro SD card as the best for recording 4K content for one big reason. It's write speed. It is 100MB/s write and also on the read side, which is great for recording 4K content. Especially if you are doing some 4K60 content. This is because it allows you to record it and it'll write to the micro SD card instantly. If you are using a slower card (say around 80MB/s) you may have to wait a few seconds or even minutes before you can record again, because the content hasn't been written to the card yet. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> With this capacity, it is also really good for recording 4K content because it's plenty of space. And 4K60 content in particular can really use up a ton of storage, pretty quickly. So getting a 128GB card is definitely a good move. And it's going to save you in the long run. </p>
<p> Samsung is known for its really great micro SD cards, and the EVO Select is no exception. In fact, this brand was the most popular micro SD card brand in 2019. </p>
<p> Best for Nintendo Switch </p>
<p> SanDisk 128GB Micro SD Card </p>
<p> This is hands-down the best micro SD card available for the Switch. And part of that is because it is officially licensed by Nintendo. But it's also because SanDisk optimized this micro SD card for the Switch. So that it works better and it is a great way to expand the storage for games on your Switch. </p>
<p> Read and write speeds here are also 100MB/s so you can load games pretty quickly. If you were to get a micro SD card that did not have these fast write speeds, then you would likely not be able to play games seamlessly from the micro SD card, as they would be slower to load. </p>
<p> 128GB really gives you a ton of storage too. Since the Switch comes with 32GB by default. You'd be giving yourself four times the storage in this tiny little micro SD card. And that's enough room to store a ton of games. Especially since Switch games are usually much smaller than PlayStation 4 and Xbox One games. </p>
<p> Best For GoPro </p>
<p> SanDisk High Endurance 128GB </p>
<p> For GoPro's getting a micro SD card that can endure loads of reading and writing, and one with fast read and write speeds is important. And that's why the SanDisk High Endurance is our pick for this category. </p>
<p> The SanDisk High Endurance micro SD card allows you to use it constantly, without worrying about it breaking down and needing to replace it. If you use your GoPro a lot, then this is the one to get. </p>
<p> And with 128GB of storage, you'll be able to record around 10,000 hours of footage in 4K on this micro SD card. So there's going to be a ton of space for recording footage from your GoPro. And if your GoPro only does 1080p video, then that number is going to more than quadruple. And not to mention, this one is also very affordable. </p>

<p> Best Of IFA 2019 – Lenovo Smart Display 7 </p>
<p> Lenovo made the first real competitor to Google's Nest Hub </p>
<p> Lenovo was a launch partner for Google Assistant displays, about a year and a half ago, with the Smart Display 8 and 10. Now Lenovo's back, with a slimmer and cheaper smart display that might be the best one yet. </p>
<p> It's smaller, and that doesn't always mean better, but when it comes to the Smart Display 7, it does. </p>
<p> Lenovo slimmed down the bezels and improved the speaker </p>
<p> The company listened to feedback from its customers, over the first two smart displays that it released. One of the big things that customers were complaining about was the speaker placement. Because it was on the left side of the display, it was not a stereo speaker, and depending on the angle that the Smart Display was at, the sound could be very hit or miss. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> So Lenovo put the speaker on the bottom, and it improved the sound of the speaker. Giving it a more immersive sound. That also makes the Smart Display look smaller. Seeing as it is not as long as the 8-inch and 10-inch models. </p>
<p> Another thing that makes the Smart Display 7 look smaller, is the smaller bezels. </p>

<p> The Lenovo Smart Display 7 is a smart display that can stand on its own. It does compete pretty heavily with Google's Nest Hub (formerly the Google Home Hub), with the same price point and and same screen size. But what sets Lenovo's apart is the better speaker, and better looks. </p>

<p> Lenovo opted for a fabric wrapped speaker, which makes the Smart Display 7 look pretty great. Especially in the gray fabric with white plastic making up the rest of the Smart Display 7. </p>

<p> Best Of IFA 2020: ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro </p>
<p> Flip up camera setup makes a return with the ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro, making the phone kind of unique, and also one of the best phones to take selfies with. </p>
<p> The ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro launched alongside its sibling, the ZenFone 7, quite recently. We’ve decided to hand the ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro one of our Best of IFA 2020 awards for several reasons, but mainly its uniqueness. The device comes with Qualcomm’s most powerful processor, while the rest of its specifications are good as well. Despite that, its price tag is not too high, the device is actually much more affordable than most mainstream flagships. All that, mixed with its sleek design, makes this phone deserving of this award, that’s for sure. </p>
<p> The ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro flip up camera module has two major positives, and only one negative </p>
<p> Including moving parts in a smartphone may not seem like a great idea. That is one major negative when it comes to the flip up camera setup on the ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro. <p> The phone is also quite powerful, and it looks extremely nice </p>

There’s very little not to like about the ASUS ZenFone 7 Pro, which is why we’ve decided to award it. </p>

<doc url="https://www.androidheadlines.com/2020/09/best-of-ifa-2020-award-blink-indoor-outdoor-security-cameras.html" parent_folder="web1" id="file17484941" filename="best-of-ifa-2020-award-blink-indoor-outdoor-security-cameras.html">
<p> Best Of IFA 2020: Blink Indoor & Outdoor Security Cameras </p>
<p> With up to four years of battery life, Blink's new cameras are the ones to beat </p>
<p> Blink announced a couple of new smart security cameras at IFA 2020 this week. The Blink Indoor and Outdoor. </p>
<p> These new security cameras are pretty impressive for a number of reasons, including the fact that they can last for four years on a single set of batteries. Meanwhile, its competition can barely hit six months. </p>
<p> That reason alone is enough to make the Blink Indoor and Outdoor cameras worthy of our Best of IFA 2020 award. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> The epic battery life is thanks to AA batteries </p>
<p> Most security cameras run off of removable and/or rechargeable batteries. So you can easily recharge them and then put it back in the camera after a few hours. But Blink is different. It runs on two AA batteries. </p>
<p> And thanks to those two AA batteries, the Blink Indoor and Outdoor cameras can last two years on a charge. Blink is able to do this thanks to their proprietary chip that is inside, it conserves a lot of battery life. Blink cameras only record when it sees motion or people. This helps conserve power, but also makes sure that your library isn't full of clips that have nothing happening. Which is also important. </p>
<p> Blink is able to get to four years of battery life, thanks to the battery expansion pack that it'll be selling later this year. This battery expansion pack can add two more AA batteries, for a total of four. And that will give you four years of battery life, before you need to think about changing them. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> What this means is that you won't need to worry about replacing the batteries anytime soon. Even on the most aggressive settings, the Blink cameras will last for years. </p>
<p> Blink cameras offer a lot of features, for not a lot of cash </p>
<p> The Blink Indoor and Outdoor security cameras are still very cheap. These are under $100, with the Indoor model being $79. That's a fraction of the cost of other wire-free security cameras on the market. And it still offers up plenty of great features. </p>
<p> These cameras will record in 1080p video, and also offer night vision. So you can see what's going on outside of your home (and inside your home) even when there are no lights on. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Two-way audio is also available, allowing you to speak to whoever is in the view of the camera. You will also get alerts on your smartphone (or via Alexa), when there is motion or people detected. </p>
<p> Finally, Blink allows you to store video clips locally. But you can also subscribe to its cloud storage plan. It is not required for any other features, other than storing your content in the cloud. </p>
<p> These are all great reasons for honoring the Blink Indoor and Outdoor cameras with AndroidHeadlines Best of IFA 2020 Award. But for us, the epic battery life of four years, really put it over the top. </p>
</doc>

<p> Best Of IFA 2020: HONOR MagicBook Pro </p>
<p> The HONOR MagicBook Pro offers compelling hardware specs, mixed with stunning design, and a fair price tag. </p>
<p> The HONOR MagicBook Pro was one of HONOR’s IFA 2020 announcements, and it deserved one of our Best of IFA 2020 awards. The MagicBook Pro is the most powerful laptop that the company announced during the show. It not only packs in extremely powerful internals, but it looks really sleek on top of that. This is supposed to be HONOR’s alternative to Apple’s MacBooks, essentially. </p>
<p> We’ll talk more about the device’s design and internals in a second, but before we get down to that it’s worth noting that it comes pre-installed with Microsoft Windows 10. This laptop is powered by AMD’s Ryzen 5 4600H processor, and it will be available to purchase in just a couple of days. </p>
<p> Premium materials & thin profile </p>
<p> The HONOR MagicBook Pro is made out of metal, aluminum, to be more accurate. The laptop features dual fans and dual heat pipes. Its enhanced cooling system produces 20-percent more airflow than your traditional cooling fans, says HONOR. The company also says that its thermal design effectively dissipates heat while ensuring minimal noise. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> This laptop is only 16.9mm thick, which basically puts it in the ultrabook category, even in that regard. It weighs 1.7 grams, so it’s fairly easy to carry around. Just looking at these specs makes you realize this is one extremely powerful machine. </p>
<p> A 16.1-inch FullView display is also included, and the device offers a 90-percent screen-to-body ratio. This is basically a 16.1-inch laptop which comes in a 15-inch form factor. Its bezels are 4.9mm thick, which is quite thin. On top of everything, fast charging is also included here. The device comes with a 65W fast charging. It will be able to charge this battery from zero to 50-percent in just a half an hour, which is great for a laptop. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Ports galore </p>
<p> The HONOR MagicBook Pro includes plenty of ports, to make you extremely productive. There is a single HDMI 2.0 port, along with three USB 3.2 Gen 1 (Type A) ports. A single USB Type-C port is included, along with an audio port (3.5mm). Bluetooth 5.0 is packed inside, as is a fingerprint scanner to make everything extra secure. This laptop offers all that for €899.99 in Europe, by the way. All this in combination makes the HONOR MagicBook Pro very deserving of the Best of IFA 2020 award. </p>

<p> Best Of IFA 2020: LG Wing </p>
<p> The LG Wing shows that the company still isn't afraid to try new things </p>
<p> Smartphones these days feel like they've hit a little bit of a plateau, but that's not really the case with the LG Wing, a pretty unique device that for its out of the box design has earned it our Best Of IFA 2020 award. </p>
<p> LG didn't officially announce the Wing at IFA 2020, but it did tease the device during the event. And it's set to make a debut on September 14. </p>
<p> Though LG is hardly the only company out there right now to have a unique smartphone or mobile device, it's still one of only a few. The LG Wing is LG's take on a smartphone that has more usable screen space. And not just by making a larger phone. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Rather, the Wing uses a secondary display that's attached to the back which can rotate outward to the side. This design presents a multitude of different ways to use the phone. Ways in which wouldn't be possible on a phone with one single display. </p>
<p> Multitasking is going to be a big feature for the LG Wing </p>
<p> As noted LG hasn't officially announced this device yet. But it has leaked recently and some of the uses were shown off. </p>
<p> The Wing is going to be a very useful multitasking device. Some examples include having navigation displayed on one screen while streaming music is displayed on the other. And both could be interacted with independently. This independent usability is what will really make the device stand out. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Another example is playing a game or watching a video on the main display in landscape mode. Meanwhile you could respond to incoming text messages on the secondary display that would be in portrait mode. </p>
<p> On top of these examples there are bound to be others. Though it'll be easy to know more on exact capabilities once the device is fully revealed. </p>
<p> An elevated viewing experience and respectable hardware </p>
<p> Based on the limited information and rumors that are already out there on the LG Wing, it'll potentially feature some respectable hardware. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Such as the Snapdragon 765G and possible 5G support. Meaning this will be a phone that is ready to take on the more advanced mobile networks of the future. LG is touting this device as being part of its newly created Explorer Project. </p>
<p> offering an elevated viewing experience to users in a way that no other device will be able to do. This slightly strange and yet, exciting and innovative concept for a smartphone has our interests at AndroidHeadlines piqued, and it's the main reason why the LG Wing is being honored with the Best Of IFA 2020 award. </p>

<p> Best Of IFA 2020: Samsung Galaxy Tab S7+ </p>
<p> Samsung's Galaxy Tab S7+ is the best Android tablet you'll ever put your hands on </p>
<p> The Galaxy Tab S7+ is Samsung's greatest achievement in the tablet space, and its slim and slender profile, high-quality features, and attractive design is why it's being honored with the Best Of IFA 2020 award. </p>
<p> There aren't many companies out there making Android tablets anymore. Samsung though, has continued to soldier on and advance its tablet lineup. Offering new tech and new features, all while improving on the design in any ways that it could. If there were improvements to be made. </p>
<p> Announced officially at Unpacked in early August, Samsung launched the Galaxy Tab S7+ and made it available for pre-order during IFA 2020 this year. And it comes with some pretty impressive specs and features. Not the least of which is its no limit refresh rate. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> This time around Samsung isn't using an adaptive refresh rate. Samsung instead lets you choose to keep the Galaxy Tab S7+ at 120Hz all the time if you wish. Which makes using the tablet and gliding through menus a very smooth and enjoyable experience. </p>
<p> A display unlike any other for a tablet </p>
<p> Samsung makes its own panels. So it's in a unique position to give its own devices the best of the best. And Samsung's panels are generally some of if not the best panels around. </p>
<p> When it came time to design the Galaxy Tab S7+, Samsung used its own Super AMOLED panel. Specifically the Galaxy Tab S7+ comes with a 12.4-inch WQXGA+ Super AMOLED panel, and it's the only tablet on the market to have it right now. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> Which means it carries a display unlike any other for a tablet. That paired with the 120Hz refresh rate that isn't limited, gives the screen a very smooth user experience with bright, vibrant colors, and superior clarity. </p>
<p> Because of these specs, the Galaxy Tab S7+ is the perfect media machine. Delivering great experiences for watching videos, doing work, and even playing games. </p>
<p> Loaded with features to help you make the most of your usage </p>
<p> Samsung has positioned this tablet to be a device that does many things. Though it does run on Android, Android as an OS has become very capable these days. Thanks to the number of full-featured productivity apps and tools. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> The Galaxy Tab S7+ takes full advantage of that by adding in features like wireless DeX. Simply engage this feature by connecting the optional keyboard accessory. Which by the way is an exceptional add-on that you'll definitely want. </p>
<p> Once DeX is turned on, you can wirelessly link the tablet to any smart TV or display that supports Miracast technology. Beyond that, you have apps and features that utilize the new and improved S Pen. Whether it's making notes on documents or drawing your latest masterpiece, the S Pen and Galaxy Tab S7+ combo is a match made in heaven. </p>
<p> And for the gamers, the Galaxy Tab S7+ is one of the few devices Samsung offers which comes with Xbox Game Pass. Meaning you have access to a ton of games to play on that large, gorgeous screen. </p>
<p> Advertisement </p>
<p> All in all, Samsung's Galaxy Tab S7+ is a masterclass in what can be done with a tablet for many reasons, which is what earned it the Best Of IFA 2020 award from AndroidHeadlines. The most standout feature for us though is that beautiful display with a high refresh rate. </p>
